page.title: 12MILFORD
page.content: Milford, on the main road from Stafford to Rugeley is frequented by visitors to Cannock Chase, a popular area for picnics and walking.The name Milford comes from mill and ford. The original mill was situated where the swimming bath house now stands at Milford Hall. The Hall was built in the late 17th Century with grounds covering over 15 acres. Interview with Paul's grandad:- My grandad,who is a retired hedge- layer,used to work on the Milford Estate. He and his family moved to their present cottage, built in the reign of George the third, in 1945. He told us "I can remember when the Hall employed many servants,but there are are none now. At one time we knew everybody but now there are a lot of new people.Many of the old buldings have been converted into homes."
